abstract: Media advocacy groups score terrorism charges brought by court in Turkey against two British Vice News journalists and an Iraqi news assistant; three are accused of knowingly helping an armed terrorist organization, which remains unnamed.
lead_paragraph: Rights groups denounced the ruling, which said the men had “knowingly and willingly helped an armed terrorist organization,” news reports said.

headline.main: Sharp Denials After Arrest of Vice News Journalists in Turkey
headline.print_headline: Sharp Denials After Arrest of Journalists in Turkey

snippet: Rights groups denounced the ruling, which said the men had “knowingly and willingly helped an armed terrorist organization,” news reports said.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
